trans-unit.source: Describes an exception that occurred during the processing of HTTP requests.
The HttpException class is an HTTP-specific exception class that enables ASP.NET to generate exception information.
For more information about throwing and handling exceptions, see [Exceptions](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpException"></xref> class and creates an empty <xref href="System.Web.HttpException"></xref> object.
When handling exceptions, it can be useful to capture a series of related exceptions with the outer exception being thrown in response to an inner exception.
A reference to the inner exception that caused the outer exception is available from the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property of the outer exception.
This mechanism preserves the error information that is carried by earlier exceptions, including the original exceptions, while allowing you to create more meaningful outer exceptions.
For more information, see <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpException"></xref> class using a supplied error message.
The error message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpException"></xref> class using an HTTP response status code and an error message.
The HTTP response status code sent to the client corresponding to this error.
The error message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpException"></xref> class with serialized data.
The HttpException constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object that is transmitted over a stream.
For more information, see [XML and SOAP Serialization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext> that holds the contextual information about the source or destination.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpException"></xref> class using an error message and the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException*> property.
When handling exceptions, it can be useful to capture a series of related exceptions with the outer exception being thrown in response to an inner exception.
A reference to the inner exception that caused the outer exception is available from the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property of the outer exception.
This mechanism preserves the error information that is carried by earlier exceptions, including the original exceptions, while allowing you to create more meaningful outer exceptions.
For more information, see <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>.
The error message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.
The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException*>, if any, that threw the current exception.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpException"></xref> class using an error message and an exception code.
The error message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.
The exception code that defines the error.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpException"></xref> class using an HTTP response status code, an error message, and the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException*> property.
When handling exceptions, it can be useful to capture a series of related exceptions with the outer exception being thrown in response to an inner exception.
A reference to the inner exception that caused the outer exception is available from the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property of the outer exception.
This mechanism preserves the error information that is carried by earlier exceptions, including the original exceptions, while allowing you to create more meaningful outer exceptions.
For more information, see <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>.
The HTTP response status code displayed on the client.
The error message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.
The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException*>, if any, that threw the current exception.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpException"></xref> class using an HTTP response status code, an error message, and an exception code.
The HTTP response status code displayed on the client.
The error message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.
The exception code that defines the error.

Creates a new <xref href="System.Web.HttpException"></xref> exception based on the error code that is returned from the Win32 API <xref uid="langword_csharp_GetLastError()" name="GetLastError()" href=""></xref> method.
The error message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.

An <xref href="System.Web.HttpException"></xref> based on the error code that is returned from a call to the Win32 API <xref uid="langword_csharp_GetLastError()" name="GetLastError()" href=""></xref> method.
Gets the HTML error message to return to the client.
The HTML error message.
Gets the HTTP response status code to return to the client.
If there is a non-zero HTTP code, it is returned.
Otherwise, the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> code is returned.
If neither an <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> code nor a non-zero HTTP code is available, the HTTP response status code 500 is returned.

For more information on HTTP response status codes, see the Status Code Definitions of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol - HTTP/1.1 on the World [Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125).
A non-zero HTTP code representing the exception or the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException*> code; otherwise, HTTP response status code 500.
Gets information about the exception and adds it to the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object.
The GetObjectData method adds information about the exception to the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> object that is targeted for serialization.
During deserialization, the exception is reconstituted from the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> that is transmitted over the stream.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext> that holds the contextual information about the source or destination.
Gets the event codes that are associated with the HTTP exception.
An integer representing a Web event code.
